newsitem.title: FRANCE: BNP bank stock suspended limit-up.
newsitem.headline: BNP bank stock suspended limit-up.

text.p: Trading in the shares of French Banque Nationale de Paris (BNP) was temporarily suspended on Wednesday under rules imposing a cooling off period for stocks which make large surges.
A spokeswoman for the SBF stock markets association said the time-out period would end at 1030 GMT and that a new ceiling of 288.2 francs had been set for the stock to retrade.
The stock was suspended after hitting 274.5 francs, up 9.98 percent.
It was the second bank stock temporarily suspended on Wednesday amid renewed sector restructuring speculation, after CCF stock was suspended briefly a short while earlier.
